title: Do you keep records of where you go and what you do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends upon what I was doing and where I was going. For work, I kept a lab notebook with various information, such as the project(s) I was working on, what I did, what were the results, and if necessary who was doing what at work, etc. In one place, I needed to keep track of the weather because some of the mineral based ceramics changed with relative humidity. Such information is also important for any legal issues to help protect yourself and also the company if necessary. If I go traveling for business, I need to keep track of expenses and my time spent working. Otherwise, I wouldn’t get refunded for the money I spent. If I go traveling for pleasure, I would keep track of where I was so that I knew what I took a picture of. Often, I would take a picture of the sign at the trail head and various signs along the way to help keep track of the sights. I would also keep a rough track of costs so that I am sure that I was not spending money uncontrollably…. I can only afford to spend so much and need to keep to my travel budget.

Yes I do. I maintain a diary to record memories about places that I visit and I put up some pictures related to it. It is a good way to keep track of all the activities that you do through out the year and I believe everyone should maintain a diary. It is a good way to look back at all the good and happy things that you did through out the year. Every year on the new year’s eve I look back at all the memories. I really feels great. Here are some records from my diary: I performed for the first time at an Open Mic this year. 2. Rose Exhibition  3. That’s my pet Mandy.  2018 has been great till now and I have a lot of such memories(records). I wish I could share all of them with you all.

No but Google does. It tracks what you say and where you go if you carry your cell phone with you as it picks up information all day long as long as it’s on. About the only contributions I make towards my daily routine record are that I have a wall calendar that I reference for appointments and what day it is and I log into Facebook numerous times a day and post things, which comes back up a year later in my “memories” feed to remind me of the dumb things I post.

I keep track of upcoming meetings and deadlines on a spreadsheet (Google Sheets) so theoretically one could go back and trace some of my whereabouts and doings. I do not keep a diary of my activities.
like a diary? not realy.. I do write down some unusual an interesting things that happen, some dreams also… so not to forget them..
Do you keep records of where you go and what you do? Facebook and Goggle do it for many people. In some countries the Government does this. Peace! 17 Nov 2018
